data.title: Audio Description Resource Guide - National Library Service for the Blind and Print Disabled (NLS)
data.meta_description: Descriptive video is a form of audio-visual translation used primarily by blind and visually impaired consumers of television and film. Television and movies use descriptive video when they employ a Secondary Audio Program (SAP), when the images and actions on screen are described during natural pauses in the dialogue. In addition to descriptive video, audio
data.meta_site_name: National Library Service for the Blind and Print Disabled (NLS) | Library of Congress
data.text:
Descriptive video is a form of audio-visual translation used primarily by blind and visually impaired consumers of television and film. Television and movies use descriptive video when they employ a Secondary Audio Program (SAP), when the images and actions on screen are described during natural pauses in the dialogue.

In addition to descriptive video, audio description includes live performances where a narrator describes the actions on stage, as well as tour guides who are trained to describe visual elements.

The Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act (CVAA) requires that ABC, CBS, Fox, and NBC television affiliates in the top sixty markets of the United States provide fifty hours of described prime time and/or children’s programming per quarter. In 2016, the Federal Communications Commission began the process of changing that requirement to approximately eighty-two hours of descriptive primetime and/or children’s programming per quarter. Descriptive video for cable television, movie theaters, DVDs, and streaming video services is also becoming widely available.

This guide provides sources of descriptive video for television, film, DVDs, and web-streaming services, as well as information on audio-described live performances and tours. The guide includes information about the CVAA, the technology and training behind descriptive video, and vendors who provide descriptive services on demand. The contact information for each organization mentioned in the guide and a bibliography for further reading can be found at the end of the document.

Contents

Sources of Descriptive Video

Broadcast and Cable Television

Feature Films

Home Video

Streaming and Web-Based Video

Further Reading on Audio Description

Descriptive Video Technology, Training, and Vendors

Performing Arts, Museums, and Tours

Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act

Bibliography

Contact Information

Sources of Descriptive Video

Broadcast and Cable Television

ABC: Audio Description

ABC

https://abc.com/audio-description External

Current list of ABC programing with audio description.

Accessibility at USA Network

USA Network

https://www.usanetwork.com/general/pages/accessibility External

Includes information on accessing video description for content on the USA Network and a schedule of descriptive content. Updated daily.

Access to Emergency Information on Television

Federal Communications Commission

www.fcc.gov/general/access-emergency-information-television External

Guidelines for using descriptive audio to relay emergency information scrolling on the bottom of a television to individuals who are blind or have a visual impairment, what emergency information should be included in the descriptive audio, and how to file a complaint.

DIRECTV: How Do I Enable My Video Description?

DIRECTV

https://support.directv.com/dtv-programming/how-do-i-enable-my-video-description External

How to utilize video description with DIRECTV.

Fox Audio Description

Fox Broadcasting

www.fox.com/article/audio-description-5987a9810054d000205ff116/ External

Lists current FOX primetime television shows with audio description.

Learn about Video Description Service

COX Cable

www.cox.com/residential/support/learn-about-video-description-service.html External

Overview of video description, instructions on setting up voice guidance, and links to managing secondary audio programming settings.

Schedule of USA Audio Described TV Programs

American Council of the Blind Audio Description Project

http://bit.ly/adptv External

Plain text weekly, day-by-day schedule of television programs with audio description.

Video Description for U-verse TV

AT&T

www.att.com/esupport/article.html#!/u-verse-tv/KM1065436 External

Introduces video description for AT&T U-verse consumers. Provides step-by-step instructions on setting up, enabling navigational sounds, and setting the default audio language and on-screen language preferences.

What is Video Description?

Comcast XFINITY

https://customer.xfinity.com/help-and-support/cable-tv/video-description/ External

Includes step-by-step instructions for enabling video description on an X1, Motorola TV BOX, SD digital adapter, or HD digital adapter.

Zap2it

Tribune Media

https://tvlistings.zap2it.com External

Provides local television listings for the United States and Canada.

Feature Films

Assistive Moviegoing: Making Movies Fun for Everyone

AMC (Lowes Cineplex Entertainment, Cineplex Odeon, General Cinema Theaters)

www.amctheatres.com/assistive-moviegoing External

Describes assistive devices available from AMC movie theaters for people with visual impairment to hear audio description of the movie. Offers moviegoers the opportunity to leave comments about specific AMC theaters by going to

www.amctheaters.com/contact/feedback External

Bow Tie Cinemas Theater Locator

Bow Tie Cinemas (Clearview Cinemas)

www.bowtiecinemas.com/locations External

Allows users to locate Bow Tie and Clearview Cinemas by address or ZIP code. Clearly states accessibility features offered on each location’s homepage.

CaptionFish Showtimes

CaptionFish

www.captionfish.com External

Displays theaters, movies, and show times near you that offer descriptive video.

Captioning and Descriptive Video

Regal Entertainment Group (United Artist Theaters, Edwards Theaters, Cineplex Odeon)

https://www.regmovies.com/static/en/us/theatre/captioning-and-descriptive-video External

Describes captioning and descriptive video services offered by Regal movie theaters. Allows users to search Regal theaters by state and equipment available.

CineMark Theaters

CineMark (Century Theaters, Tinseltown USA, CineArts, and Rave Cinemas)

www.cinemark.com/theatres.aspx External

Allows users to search for a CineMark theater by city, state, or zip code. Individual movie titles listed in show times indicate whether a movie has an audio description option.

Described Movies at Local Theaters

Described and Captioned Media Program

www.dcmp.org/caai/nadh199.pdf [PDF]External

Introduces what described theater is, describes what kind of equipment is used, and provides links for finding theaters with video description.

Fandango

www.Fandango.com External

Allows users to search show times by city, state, ZIP code, or movie. Highlights accessibility devices available at the theater/movie chosen above the show times. Also available on an app.

Landmark Theatres: Accessibility Equipment

Landmark Theatres

https://www.landmarktheatres.com/httpswwwlandmarktheatrescomaccessibility-equipment External

Overview with illustrations of the accessibility equipment, including audio description, used in Landmark theaters. List of theaters by state includes accessibility features offered at that theater.

MoPix: Motion Picture Access

http://ncam.wgbh.org/mopix/nowshowing.html External

Find current movies offered with descriptive video and search theaters with descriptive audio in the United States and Canada.

Showcase Cinemas: Assistive Moviegoing

Showcase Cinemas (Cinema Du Lux Multiplex, National Amusements, Superlux Locations)

https://www.showcasecinemas.com/assistive-moviegoing External

Information on visual and audio aid technology available through Showcase Cinemas.

Home Video

DVDs and Blu-ray Discs with Audio Description

American Council of the Blind, Audio Description Project

https://adp.acb.org/dvds.html External

Lists DVDs and Blu-ray Discs with audio description for the current year with the newest releases listed first. DVDs for past years listed back to 2010.

Streaming and Web-Based Video

Amazon Digital Content: Turn on Audio Descriptions

Amazon Prime

https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?ref_=hp_left_v4_sib&nodeId=GCLGRJE9934K282F External

Step-by-step instructions for turning audio descriptions on when watching streaming content on Amazon.

Audio Descriptions for Netflix Movies and TV Shows

Netflix

https://help.netflix.com/en/node/25079 External

Links to titles on Netflix with audio description, lists devices that will play audio description on Netflix, and provides contact information to get technical support.

Captioning and Video Description for the Web

Media Access Group at WGBH

http://main.wgbh.org/wgbh/pages/mag/pdfs/marketing_web.captioning.pdf [PDF]External

Discusses adding captions and descriptive video to videos on websites.

Disney Movies Anywhere Audio Description

Disney Movies Anywhere

www.disneymoviesanywhere.com/#14484 External

Discusses how to enable audio description for the Disney Movies Anywhere app currently available on iTunes, Amazon Prime, Google Play, VIDI, and Microsoft Movies and TV.

Find audio-described content in the iTunes Store

Apple Support

https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT205742 External

Provides step-by-step instructions for finding, downloading, and viewing descriptive video for iTunes content from a Mac or PC computer, iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch, or Apple TV.

How to Audio Describe a YouTube Video

Media Access Australia

https://mediaaccess.org.au/web/how-to-audio-describe-a-youtube-video External

Discusses different options for adding audio description to YouTube videos.

How to Find Accessible Media

Media Access Australia

https://mediaaccess.org.au/web/how-to-find-accessible-media External

Guidance on how to find audio description and closed captioned videos on iTunes and YouTube.

New and Future Releases

Amazon.com

www.amazon.com/new-releases-dvd-bluray/b/ref=sv_mov_0?ie=UTF8&node=2921748011 External

Lists new and future releases of movies and TV shows with descriptive audio. Includes DVD and Amazon Video, Amazon’s streaming video service.

Streaming Video

American Council of the Blind, Audio Description Project

about.proquest.com/en/content-solutions/videos External

Lists programming with audio description available from streaming video providers and web services.

Vimeo: Audio Described

Vimeo

https://vimeo.com/search?q=%22audio+description%22+%7C+%22audio+described%22 External

Allows users to search for videos with audio description on the streaming web service Vimeo.

Further Reading on Audio Description

Descriptive Video Technology, Training, and Vendors

3PlayMedia

www.3playmedia.com External

Accessible media company provides descriptive audio and closed captioning serves.

Accessibility Solutions and Research Center

www.amacusg.org/captioning.php External

Non-profit educational organization providing audio description for students accessing video as part of their classroom experience.

Access-USA

www.access-usa.com External

North American production house for all types of alternative media.

Arts Access

www.artsaccessinc.org External

Non-profit organization providing audio description on demand. Works with movie theaters to supply the Arts Access Audio Description headset for live performances. Website includes a list of services, a schedule of current audio described performances, and a directory of individuals and companies that supply audio description for live performances on demand.

Audio Description Institute

American Council of the Blind

adp.acb.org/education.html External

Source of training in audio description. Held as part of ACB’s Annual Conference in July and at several other times throughout the year.

Audio Description Training and Education Resources

American Council of the Blind, Audio Description Project

adp.acb.org/education.html External

Organization providing information on audio-describer training, educational description, and articles on the methods used to create audio description.

Audio Descriptive Associates: Training

www.audiodescribe.com/training/ External

Audio description vendor offering training and workshops.

Descriptive Narration for TV, Films and Web-based Video

Media Access Group at WGBH

http://main.wgbh.org/wgbh/pages/mag/pdfs/wgbh_descriptive_narration.pdf [PDF]External

An introduction to described video.

The Development of the Descriptive Video Services

National Center to Improve Practice in Special Education through Technology, Media and Materials

www2.edc.org/NCIP/library/v&c/cronin.htm External

A detailed history of the development of descriptive video.

DV Works

www.descriptivevideoworks.com External

Organization providing audio description services for NBC, CBS, the Discovery Channel, Viacom channels (including Bravo, Comedy Central, VH1, and MTV), and the A&E channel. DV Works has described more than 11,000 television shows, including the recent Rio Olympic Games, and 800 major movies. Member of the Netflix Post Partner Program.

Media Access Group at WGBH

http://main.wgbh.org/wgbh/pages/mag/ External

Provider of closed captioning and descriptive video.

Use Audio Descriptions to Hear Narration Describing a Video Clip, Show, or Movie

Apple Support

https://www.showcasecinemas.com/assistive-moviegoing External

Instructions on how to turn on audio descriptions to view iTunes content on a Mac, iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch and how to create descriptive audio in Final Cut Pro X.

Performing Arts, Museums, and Tours

Leadership Exchange in Arts and Disability

The Kennedy Center

http://education.kennedy-center.org/education/accessibility/lead/ External

Describes methods for implementing accessibility in cultural environments, communicates information about arts and accessibility, and shares resources and knowledge among professionals.

Making Museums & Cultural Institutions Accessible

Media Access Group at WGBH

http://main.wgbh.org/wgbh/pages/mag/pdfs/WGBHMarketingFlyer.pdf [PDF]External

Includes ways to enhance the museum experience for visitors with disabilities.

Performing Arts with Audio Description

American Council of the Blind, Audio Description Project

adp.acb.org/theatres.html External

Offers overview of audio description of live performances.

Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act (CVAA)

Consumer Guide: Twenty-First Century Communications and Video

Accessibility Act

Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

https://transition.fcc.gov/cgb/consumerfacts/CVAA-access-act.pdf [PDF]External

A short introduction to the Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act (CVAA), including what it means for consumers.

Consumer Help Center: Access for People with Disabilities

Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

https://consumercomplaints.fcc.gov/hc/en-us/sections/200700550-Guides-to-Filing-Accessibility-Complaints External

Guidelines for filing an accessibility complaint with the FCC.

Legal Requirements for Audio Description

3Play Media

www.3playmedia.com/2017/03/22/legal-requirements-audio-description/ External

Article explores federal laws and regulations regarding descriptive video services.

Media Bureau Announces Comment and Reply Deadlines for Video Description Expansion Notice of Proposed Rulemaking

Federal Communications Commission

https://apps.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DA-16-596A1.pdf [PDF]External

Official public notice of the FCC’s intention to expand the hours that broadcast networks are required to offer descriptive audio.

Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act

Federal Communications Commission

www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/21st-century-communications-and-video-accessibility-act-cvaa External

A line-by-line consumer guide to the Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act of 2010. Also available in Spanish.

Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act

Federal Communications Commission

www.fcc.gov/general/twenty-first-century-communications-and-video-accessibility-act-0 External

Summary of the Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act of 2010.

Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act of 2010

US Government Information

www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/BILLS-111s3304enr/pdf/BILLS-111s3304enr.pdf [PDF]External

Official text of the 2010 act to increase the access of people with disabilities to modern communications.

Video Description of Video Programming

US Government Publishing Office (GPO)

www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?SID=7435e6f252ce50bfd33e3de98ae55bb8&mc=true&node=se47.4.79_13&rgn=div8 External

Text of the Code of Federal Regulations, Title 47 (Telecommunication), Part 79 (Accessibility of Video Programming), §79.3.

Bibliography

Aafaq, Nayyer, Syed Zulqarnain Gilani, Wei Liu, and Ajmal Mian. “Video Description: A Survey of Methods, Datasets, and Evaluation Metrics.” ArXiv:1806.00186, June 1, 2018. Retrieved from https://arxiv.org/abs/1806.00186. External

Alamri, Huda, Vincent Cartillier, Rapheal Gontijo Lopes, Abhishek Das, Jue Wang, Irfan Essa, Dhruv Batra, et al. “Audio Visual Scene-Aware Dialog (AVSD) Challenge at DSTC7.” ArVix, June 1, 2018.

Anderman, Gunilla, and Jorge Diaz-Cintas, eds. Audiovisual Translation:Language Transfer on Screen. New York, NY: Palgrave Macmillan, 2009.

Cintas, Jorge Diaz, Pilar Orero, and Aline Remael, eds. Media for All: Subtitling for the Deaf, Audio Description, and Sign Language (Approaches to Translation Studies 30). 1st ed. New York, NY: Rodopi, 2007.

Cryer, Heather and Sarah Home. “Exploring the Use of Synthetic Speech by Blind and Partially Sighted People.” RNIB Centre for Accessible Information. Birmingham, UK: Literature Review #2, November 2008.

Cryer, Heather and Sarah Home. “User attitudes towards synthetic speech for Talking Books.” RNIB Centre for Accessible Information. Birmingham, UK: Research Report #7, May 13, 2009.

Douze, Matthijs, Hervé Jégou, Cordelia Schmid, and Patrick Pérez. “Compact Video Description for Copy Detection with Precise Temporal Alignment.” In European Conference on Computer Vision (ECCV ’10), 522-35. Proceedings of Compact Video Description for Copy Detection with Precise Temporal Alignment, Greece, Heraklion. Vol. 6311. Berlin: Springer-Verlag, 2010.

Kent, Michael, Katie Ellis, and Kathryn Locke. Audio Description and Australian Television: A Position Paper. Working paper. School of Media, Creative Arts and Social Inquiry (MCASI), Curtin University of Technology, School of Media. 2018.

Kent, Michael, Katie Ellis, Gwyneth Peaty, Latter Natalie, and Kathryn Locke. Mainstreaming Captions for Online Lectures in Higher Education in Australia. Working Paper. Curtin University of Technology, Department of Internet Studies. 2017.

Laokulrat, Natsuda, Naoaki Okazaki, and Hideki Nakayama. “Incorporating Semantic Attention in Video Description Generation.” In LREC. 2018. Retrieved from www.lrec-conf.org/proceedings/lrec2018/pdf/98.pdf. [pdf]External
